intro: Syzygium gjellerupii, commonly known as the Gjellerup apple or the Christmas apple, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to the tropical rainforests of northern Australia, particularly in the Cape York Peninsula. The plant is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves and small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a small, round, red or yellow berry that is edible and has a sweet, acidic flavor. Syzygium gjellerupii is often found growing in dense understorey vegetation and is adapted to the humid, shaded conditions of its native habitat.
